description: Wales will face Scotland for ninth or 10th place at the Netball World Cup after beating Trinidad and Tobago in their final pool game.
title: Netball World Cup: Wales 70-55 Trinidad and Tobago - Feathers secure top 10 finish
title_page: Netball World Cup: Wales 70-55 Trinidad and Tobago - Feathers secure top 10 finish - BBC Sport
maintext:
Wales will compete for ninth or 10th place at the Netball World Cup after beating Trinidad and Tobago in their final pool game.
The Welsh Feathers led 18-14 at the end of the first quarter and 32-28 after a tight and physical first half.
However a 10-goal third period advantage saw them take control of the game which they won 70-55.
Wales finish fifth in Pool G and will play Scotland in their placing match on Saturday (17:00 BST).
Scotland, who finished fifth in Pool F after beating Fiji 62-46, were beaten 56-52 by Wales in a final warm-up match before the tournament in Cape Town, South Africa.
The Feathers had lost all eight previous World Cup meetings with Trinidad and Tobago and the Calypso Girls made the early running in a close opening quarter.
However, Wales capitalised on a couple of errors to establish a four-goal lead at the first break.
